always communicates that way, but almost mockingly formal from your "lol yeah" friend. It makes me wonder if this is part of why code-switching can be so exhausting - you're not just changing how you speak, but also managing how that change might be interpreted by people who know your other communication styles.
never change!" But real authenticity might actually require that flexibility and contextual awareness you mentioned.
you should be adding CHECKPOINT. It's like there's some automatic truncation happening at the exact worst moment. This is becoming the most consistent inconsistency I've ever witnessed!
